item.description: First Semester: Conception et Exploitation des Bases de Données Cours de niveau L3 Informatique. Cours de bases de données, qui fait suite à un premier cours en L2 de bases de données. TPs en SQL. Projet en SQL+Python. Responsables du cours: Mario Cortes-Cornax.

Second Semester: Operation Research Cours de niveau M1 Informatique. Chargé de TD. Responsable du cours: Nadia Brauner. First Semester: INF303: Modélisation des structures informatiques Cours de niveau L2 Informatique. Algorithmes et notions de base de théorie des graphes. Chargé de TD et TP. TPs en langage Python. Responsables du cours: Julie Peyre et Aurélie Lagoutte.

item.title: Research Interests
item.description: I am mainly interested in Graph theory, and more specifically I love graph problems involving a topological intuition. A few topics I am working on: Cayley graphs, geometric group theory, canonical tree-decompositions, twin-width, universal covering, evasiveness of graph properties, small cancellation theory, fractional colouring of graphs.

Second Semester: INF402: Introduction à la logique Cours de niveau L2 Informatique. Chargé de TD (seulement pour la première partie: logique booléenne). Responsable du cours: Benjamin Wack. First Semester: INF301: Algorithmique et Programmation Impérative Cours de niveau L2 Informatique. Chargé de TD et TP. Projets en langage C, sous forme d’APPs. Responsable du cours: Florent Bouchez-Tichadou.

item.title: Publications and preprints
item.description: Preprints Journal and Conference Publications Coarse geometry of quasi-transitive graphs beyond planarity [arXiv] Louis Esperet, U.G. The Electronic Jouranl of Combinatorics, 31(2), P2.41 (2024). Optimization in graphical small cancellation theory [arXiv] Louis Esperet, U.G. Discrete Mathematics, 347(4) (2024) . The structure of quasi-transitive graphs avoiding a minor with applications to the domino problem [arXiv] Louis Esperet, U.G., Clément Legrand-Duchesne. Short version in Eurocomb 2023. Twin-width V: linear minors, modular counting, and matrix multiplication [arXiv]

item.title: Talks
item.description: Some presentations I gave: Introduction to graph streaming algorithms (for non specialists) [slides] Journées CALAMAR 2024 (online) Minor exclusion in quasi-transitive graphs [slides] [slides2] Rauzy Seminar, FRUMAM Marseille (2023) JGA 2023, Université Lyon 1 LoGAlg 2023, Warsawa GREYC Caen, Algorithmic seminar (2023) Eurocomb 2023, Praha Université Paris-Saclay, GALAC team seminar (2023) Universität Hamburg, Discrete mathematics team seminar (2023) Twin-width V: linear minors, modular counting and matrix multiplication [slides] STACS 2023, Hamburg

item.title: Short CV
item.description: I was born in La Seyne-sur-Mer and grew up in Aix-en-Provence. I did two years of scientific preparatory classes in my former high school, the Lycée Paul Cézanne. Then I studied three years in the ENS de Lyon, where I obtained both my Licence and Master degrees in Fundamental Computer Sciences. In the context of the “Diplôme de l’ENS de Lyon” (which basically consisted in achieving a long series of terribly difficult and useless administrative tasks to end with an additional diplom), I did did two long research internships during the 2021-2022 scholar year, in the MC2 team of ENS de Lyon and then in the ACRO team of LIS-lab in Marseille.
